ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: Hard, intense course on American institutions. Strongly recommended for any student interested in researching American politics.
Yes, I would recommend the course to students that require a greater understanding of the politics of American political institutions.

An overview of the main topics/concepts in research on institutions in the American politics subfield.I would highly recommend this course to anyone interested in studying American politics or political institutions in general.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: Incredibly useful for comp exams and the course will eventually play a role in my future research.

This course will contribute substantially to my future research and professional work. The concepts I learned in this course will help me accurately describe and evaluate the bureaucracy where I work. It also helped me think about how my workplace fits into the larger constellation of American political institutions.

This course covers a major part of my main substantive field in political science and is therefore a great preparation for the qualifying exams. In addition, I plan on doing research on institutions, whether in my dissertation or not, and this course has helped me to identify potential topics for that research.
